    Rating: 5

    2013-01-29: Looking to purchase a headset for a run or workout at the gym? This is the way to go!If you do a little research you will find that every single over the ear bluetooth set falls victim to sweat and moisture making its way into the circuitry and shorting it out... regardless of the 'Sweatproof' adverts. The only solution thus far seems to be moving the hardware to your neckline away from those hotspots. I have officially hit 4 months of constant use running and hitting the gym 3-5 times a week without a hitch. The convenience is unparalleled as you can run with your phone on your arm or workout with the phone on the ground next to you. I have taken calls in the middle of a set by simply hitting the call button. Change tracks on Pandora or even hold and speak to do voice commands. The possibilities are endless.Cons- The from factor makes for a bumpy ride if you are not wearing a shirt during a run. Normal use typically makes one end hang lower than the other which makes it feel awkward at first. Headphones can get wrapped around the set itself as the magnets are not very powerful.

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-13: I've had these for just over a month now and they work as intended. They're light so you don't even know they're there and they're comfortable. Only fitment issue I've had are that the size/shape of the ear bud is just big enough that it doesn't quite fit properly in my ear canal. At first I thought it was the silicon bulbs but the problem still persisted even after I swapped the bulbs from my old ear buds which fit me perfectly and never came loose. I compared the size of these ear buds to my old pair and these were a touch bigger. If I'm just sitting down they stay seated in my ear canals fine, it's when I'm moving around that they come loose and the noise cancelling effect is diminished. Not a big deal but just a concern if you feel as though you have smaller ear canals.The buttons are a bit too easy to activate. It would be nice if they were a bit firmer or required a more deliberate push to activate the intended function. It's too easy to bump something or if I reach to adjust the headset on my neck I will accidentally tap a button when grabbing for the headset.The sound quality is so-so. This is my first pair of Bluetooth earbuds so I can only compare to my old wired earbuds which sound great, IMHO. I've never really heard much bass, and the sound overall is a bit hollow (if that makes sense?) and on the tinny side. Adequate but nothing special.I've used this headset with a Samsung Galaxy S and now with a Galaxy SIII, along with my wife's HTC Windows phone and it paired fine with all three. The only functionality issues I've had with both Galaxy phones is that I will hit the play/pause button to pause music and then if it sits paused long enough, when I hit the play button again it won't restart the music. When I look at the phone I see that each time I hit the play/pause button it's actually skipping to the next song but never actually plays it. I have to start the music on my phone again and then the play/pause button functions properly. I'm using PowerAmp on my Android phone as my music player so it may be an issue with PowerAmp as much as it may be an issue with the headset. I haven't tried it with any other media player on my phone to determine which is to blame. I only used them once for a brief time on my wife's Windows phone so I didn't thoroughly test out the full functionality on that phone.I've used these when walking/jogging, mowing the yard, riding my motorcycle, and just working around my house. They're always comfortable and I sometimes forget they're even there until I bend over or lean back or do something that causes the headset to slide up my neck or fall off my neck. I've had a few times where I've been wearing them while sweating profusely and so far, so good, they're doing okay.If I could make one improvement to the headset it would be to put some sort of rigid beam in the actual headset so that you can actually form the headset to stay in fitted position - picture a piece of wire hanger running through the headset - so you can manipulate the shape a bit and have it stay in that shape. This would be a huge benefit when I'm riding my motorcycle.Speaking of using them on my motorcycle. I searched the reviews as I purchased these specifically for use when riding my motorcycle and several reviews said they worked great on their motorcycle and didn't have any problems. I have to respectively, but vehemently, disagree with each and every one of them. I ride a sportbike and wear a full face (non-modular) helmet and a leather jacket with a bit of a collar. My first few rides I put on my jacket and put the headset on the outside of my jacket and the thing flew all over the place and smack up against my helmet, and if it wasn't blowing around, whenever I would turn my head to do a lane check, or look down to check my speed I routinely bumped a button causing an undesired result. I tucked the headset in my jacket and it still randomly tapped a button when I moved my head around or the headset just happened to shift in an unfortunate manner and would press up against the jacket collar. The only way I can wear these when riding my bike is to turn them backwards (opening is on the back of my neck) and flip'em upside down and then tuck the front into my collar and leave the sides (where the buttons are) exposed above my collar. It works but this is the main reason I would love to have some sort of semi-rigid spine in the headset that would allow me to bend and form the headset around my neck to keep it from flapping around. I'm still trying to think of some way to fit something to the headset to allow me to form it securely around my neck. I'm not knocking the headset for this, just sharing my experience that this may not work for you if you intend to wear them while on your motorcycle.I have yet to use them to a point that they've clearly run out of battery power. At most I've got them on for about 30-35 minutes at a time once or twice a day. I just tend to charge them about once every 7-9 days just to avoid them actually running out of juice when I really wanted to use them. For this reason I won't really comment on battery life.For the desire of the headset having some rigidness for mold-ability I knocked off a half-star - not that the headset doesn't function properly, just that this would be an improvement I think a lot of people would appreciate. The other 1-1/2 stars is for the too-easily-activated buttons and the okay sound quality. Firm up the buttons and improve the speakers and this is a solid 4-1/2 star product.**UPDATE** 9/3/2013:Just wanted to update this review after owning these for so long...Since last March I started jogging/running pretty much every day for 30-45 minutes outdoors along with going to the gym to lift weights several days a week. I've logged hundreds of miles on these earbuds and happy to say, despite all the sweat these things have seen, they're still working great. The charge still seems to last the same as well, I've only fully drained them a few times after multiple uses for varying amounts of time. One thing I've discovered is sometimes, depending on the pace of my jog, the headset tends to bounce around a bit and will hit against my collar bones. It isn't truly painful but definitely irritating after awhile. Additionally, when jogging, the same pace which causes them to bounce off my collar bones also causes the headset to shift around on my neck so I am constantly re-adjusting them to not be lopsided to one side or the other. These two traits only serve to reinforce my original suggestion of some form of rigidness to the spine of the headset. If you're a runner this may be of some concern for you; still nothing I would consider a deal-breaker, but felt it noteworthy nonetheless.Additionally, since my original review, I've also picked up an ASUS TF-700 tablet. The headset has an issue with connecting with the tablet; it works, but each time I pair the 2 I have to go into the Bluetooth settings and tap the headset entry to manually begin the pairing process as opposed to just turning on the Bluetooth antenna and the LG headset then waiting for the automatic pairing to take place. Additionally, and this is a ding against the tablet but related to the headset, ASUS, for some reason, decided to have Bluetooth and wi-fi share the same antenna. If you like to stream anything from the Internet - Netflix, YouTube, etc. - the audio will not be in sync; about a solid half-second delay in the characters' mouths moving and the dialogue being heard through the headset. If I intend to watch any streaming videos through my tablet I make sure to have a pair of wired earbuds with me. This is not an issue when watching videos stored on the tablet itself or an inserted memory card. Again, not a fault of the headset, just noting the issue.

    Rating: 3

    2013-06-20: The around-the-neck design is good for all-day use and the earbuds fit my ears. I look dorky wearing it but I like it better than all the other wireless headsets in my drawer.The only downside is.. it is a little cumbersome to connect to two devices at once. Unlike my Plantronics or Jawbone bluetooth headsets which can be connected to 2 phones at the same time, this headset can only be connected to a phone and another device for audio. I don't find myself bothering with the feature since it doesn't fit my needs.

    Rating: 4

    2012-07-22: What I like:Call quality is acceptable. As good as any other wireless headset I've used and far better than my Sennheiser MM400s. The vibrating neckband is killer.I like having an analog on/off switch. This is missing on nearly everything these days.The form factor is great. I wear it everywhere under my shirt collar in a business casual environment. Hints of wires would be visible if you are wearing a more formal white business shirt, but my collared polo and sport shirts hide it well. The form factor is why you should buy this and why you will love it. As I stated before, I own the superior Sennheiser MM400 which has amazing audio quality. I rarely have the MM400 with me because it is not designed to wear as a business accessory. The form factor of these is perfect. Absolutely perfect. These will go with you everywhere. You will not look like a gadget spaz like the guys using the normal bluetooth accessories. When wearing the buds, you are wearing plain buds. They easily tuck away under your collar when not in use. The only bad thing about the aesthetics is the flashing blue light, but this is concealed by your collar.What I don't like:Unfortunately, the stereo sound quality is pretty poor. They don't sound as good as stock iPhone/iPod buds. They sound like cheap $10-$20 buds. Highs and lows are clipped. They funnel all sound into the muddy mids. Imagine a stock FM car stereo from 1984. I'd gladly pay $200 more for this form factor with the sound quality of my Sennheiser MM400s.Conclusion:Buy these. Buy them now. For <$50, they are a great value and you will use them every day. I gave them 3 stars but they really almost merit four when you consider how flippin' cheap they are.For listening to music in a less-portable more-conspicuous form factor, buy yourself a pair of good quality Sennheisers (wired or bluetooth, they are the best for sound quality).

    Rating: 3

    2012-02-02: I work at a cell phone provider (where we sell these for $70) and these are the staff favorite. To say that 90% of our staff uses this bluetooth on a daily basis would not be far fetched. Great sound quality, fantastic battery life, as comfortable as any headset I've owned. Fantastic for active lifestyles. I've had mine since May and the only issue I've had with mine is that one of the plastic clips that hold the earpiece wire to the band broke, which is no big deal to me.

    2013-05-23: Unlike my previous Motorola BT headphones, the LG continue to offer 8 hours of nonstop playback, while still remaining in one piece. These are excellent and well worth their reasonable price.

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-11: I bought these to replace samsung units that failed me. These had favorable reviews wanted to give them a shot. Had for one day and this is what I have to say.1. Very Comfortable, hardly know they are there.2. Respectable sound. Not as good as quality wired headphones, but pretty good. Had trouble with garble from my HTC EVO LTE, but found conflict between Beats EQ on Phone and EQ on headset. Turned off headset EQ, sound better.3. Connectivity. Pairing was a snap, super easy, turn them both on set search and done. Connection is more steady than old Samsung units, but be aware, the owners manual says 33 feet, they are dreaming! Putting it in your back pocket can cause problems! If it is in your front jeans pocket should be fine.4. Fashion: NOT! They look kinda wierd. They get attention alright...if you like that sort of "What is that massager thing around your neck " thing.Overall after day one I am happy with them and they do what I want.I recommend and will update as time goes by.++++Update March 5 , 2013The Battery Life on these is Amazing. Part time use (2-3 Hours a day, has lead to going 7,8,9, 10 days between full charges! Sound I would still rate as decent, not exceptional. One con is I am a big man with a 19" neck so sometimes my neck pushes buttons inadvertantly. But it is no big deal. Still loving them!Enjoy.JB

    Rating: 4

    2012-02-04: There are plenty of super elaborate reviews on this headset, so I am not going to write another long one. Almost all of the good stuff said about this Headset are absolutely true.Especially Good:* Lightweight* Keeps BT radiation further from your brain than most (i.e. BTR is not directly in your ear)* Great sound quality, I am sure there are superior analog buds, but they sound great to me.* I use these for exercise. I wrap the headphones under my necklace to keep the headset around my neck.* Magnetic earbud holders pretty much set a new standard.The Bad:* Serious connectivity issues when listening to streamed music on my phone. Does not work as well with wifi enabled, but this could just be my phone. Tested with Grooveshark and Pandora on a Nexus One.* When Jogging, I use a very small back pack to hold my phone and everything works as expected. When walking with the same backpack, more connectivity issues (wtf is that?!). Oh well, works perfectly fine in my pocket.* Constant blinking blue light when in use or listening to music. Can be annoying when in the dark.* Doesn't work well (for me) when connecting to a PC, either in Windows or Linux (poor sound quality). Did not test with a Mac.I do not in any way regret my purchase at all. Perfect dedicated headset for my phone which was the only reason why I purchased it. I wish streamed music would not cause connection issues, but I have no problem getting more MP3s for my phone so as to avoid these issues. Will test with a kindle fire soon and update this review to see if streamed music still causes issues.

    Rating: 5

    2012-04-27: I purchased these for my wife because she likes to listen to audio books a lot. She is constantly complaining about catching her earphone cables on things as she works around the home so I thought this would be a nice gift. The first thing she said is that they were comfortable to wear and she really didn't even know she had them on.The sound out of them is pretty good and the dynamic range is not bad at all. She uses them on her iPhone and iPad 2 to listen to music and audio books. Now she can lay her phone or iPad 2 down in the kitchen and walk about 35 feet away in any direction with very good reception. This includes shooting the Bluetooth signal through 2 walls. At 40 to 45 feet the sound starts breaking up and at 45 feet it just loses connection. As you walk back into range it immediately reconnects to the source.The headphones can connect to two devices but only one of them can be a phone. Set it up with your phone first and then use the manual linking method to set it up with a playing device only, like an iPad.The earphones come with a recharger pack and they charged very quickly. You can listen to music or talk on the phone 10 hours before needing to recharge.The headset has multiple buttons for your use while wearing the device. There is an on/off switch, volume up/down rocker switch, a call switch that is used for connecting and disconnecting from calls and pairing the headset to your device and a microphone all located on the LH side. The call button also has a blue LED ring around it that is a solid blue when the headset is searching for a pairing device and it flashes blue when it is in normal operating mode. While charging, the headset is off and the blue ring turns to red. When the charger is connected the headset turns off regardless of what position the on/off switch is in. There is also a charging port on the inner side of the LH part of the headset. On the RH side there is a Rew/FF button, and a play/pause button. The earplugs magnetically fit into the headset when not in use.The LED ring around the call button can also help you to determine the amount of charge left in the headset. If you press and hold the call button for 3 seconds the LED ring will light up for 1 second. Solid blue means high charge, violet means medium charge and red means low charge.While playing music you can skip forward or back one song or chapter by quickly pressing the REW/FF rocker switch. If you hold the switch you can speed forward or back as long as you hold the switch down. You can answer a call, transfer a call, voice dial, recall the last number dialed, end a call, go to call waiting or reject a call all by using the call button. Remember your phone device must be able to handle these types of actions for them to work.Our unit came with two different sets of ear buds that looked like medium and large. Make sure that you use the set that best fits into your ear for comfort and also for good noise blocking. It will also help you to get the best sound as most of the audio output will be directed into your ear and give you the best sound. If they are too loose then part of the sound is lost and you will not get the best sound fidelity.The unit also features a bass boost that can be turned on. If you press the up and down volume rocker switch on both sides for 1 second it will switch between normal EQ or Bass Boost. You will hear a beep in the headset when the change is made.Cons:Some items on the device seem fragile as the headset is really a high tech miniature piece of electronics. The flap that covers the charging port for example just seems excessively fragile.There is the geek effect in that you have this ring around your neck and there is a flashing blue light going when you have it turned on. You forget you are wearing it but people do look at you sort of strangely.One thing that I did not like is that when we received the unit we noticed that the internal box that contained the headset had been opened before we got it. The special sealing tape from the factory had been cut and the wall charger plastic bag had been opened. In addition there was an empty bag for another set of ear buds. When we purchased the unit it was supposed to be new and the fact that it was opened indicated that it had either been returned or opened in the warehouse. I don't care for that as I paid for new merchandise but the unit has performed well so far. I didn't deduct any stars for the opened box as it does not reflect on the product but it certainly does on the seller!Overall we like the headset and I would recommend it to you!

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-06: I've tried a bunch of bluetooth headsets and this one is the best one I've found so far. They are good for biking, rollerskating, erging (rowing on a stationary rower) and walking all over the place to do errands.Since the bulk of the headset rests around your neck, the earbuds are really light, which helps them stay in your ear. I did end up putting my own silicone tips on them because the ones that come with didn't fit me quite right, but I usually have this problem with most silicone earbud tips.When I first got these, I never really used them to talk to people, in fact I wasn't even pairing them with my phone. Then one time I did have them paired to my phone and I heard a noise and pressed a button and what's this? I'm having a conversation with someone on my phone! I was riding my bike in traffic at the time, had no idea what I was doing and yet was able to answer the phone, have a conversation and then hang up afterwards, so I'd say the controls are pretty intuitive. I've used some other headsets where buttons do a lot of different things, since there just aren't that many buttons, but these let you answer the call on your left, pause your music with the right, raising and lowering volume is on one side, going forward and back on tracks is on the other. I really find it easier to navigate than the styles that try to be smaller and more compact.They do move around sometimes. Especially when riding my bike, they will EVENTUALLY start twisting to the side so by the time I've finished a ride and removed my sling bag, sometimes they are completely out of place and maybe hanging off my back on one side. Meanwhile, of course the earbuds will have fallen out. When they do come out, though, there is never a yanking out from the ears as I've experienced with other headsets with earbuds. The earbuds also come out of their magnetic holders sometimes, but overall they stay put pretty well.I will often be wearing these when I get wherever I'm going walking or biking and I don't find people staring at them strangely or even seeming to notice them much, which I think it a plus.The sound is decent quality and there is some noise cancelling going on. I sometimes wear just one ear at a time, especially if I'm in traffic or I just want to hear what's going on around me. I do find that weird head movements (especially biking or maybe rooting around in my bag while on the train) can sometimes cause buttons to be pushed, like all of a sudden I guess I've pushed the pause button with my chin or turned the volume up/down when twisting around.I sometimes lose the connection for a moment or off and on depending on where the phone is in relation to the headset. On my bike, I've had pretty good luck with it when the phone is in a pannier on the back of the bike, but sometimes when it's in a bag on my back, I lose the signal. It seems to help when I put my iPhone 4s into the outside pocket of my bag, upside down. Lately, I've done even better by getting a little bag that fastens to the front of the top tube of my bike frame (up by the fork.)Cycling JFLY Roswheel Frame BagIt's meant to hold a phone and not only does it maintain my bluetooth connection but I can actually look at my phone to do things like find out what time it is.The customer support from LG is not very good. I was having trouble pairing my headset with my phone at one point (it just wasn't working) and the LG support site had a list of all these different electronic items so you could find yours and get an automatic service/return request and this headset wasn't on the list so it required actually being on hold and talking to a human and asked some silly questions before being given instructions for sending in the headset (with me paying for shipping.) Then I didn't hear anything from them for a while, then one day my headset showed back up with a note that seemed to be saying I forgot to put my proof of purchase in with the headset so they didn't work on it BUT I tried it again and it seemed to be working so...whatever, I don't know. It's out of warranty now as I write this anyway, so not something I have to worry about any more! At least it's working, but if it wasn't, unless something better has come along in the meantime, I'd probably buy another of this same style because of it's multiple activity uses, general ease of use and fairly long battery life.Oh, I should also mention that I have sweated on it quite a bit and that hasn't seemed to affect it at all.

    Rating: 4

    2013-04-08: I like these bluetooth head phones. I use them on my motorcyle, mowing the lawn, and watching movies and music on airplanes. I'd recommend to anyone, and I'd probably buy another set.

    2012-05-25: I've only had these for 48 hours, but so far I am loving these headphones. I bought them because I had broken 3 wired pairs in the past 2 months, all at the base where they plug into my iPhone. I'm not an audiophile, but I'd say the sounds quality is great; comparable to the $20-$25 headphones that I usually buy and I was surprised that the phone call quality is better than my dedicated Plantronics Discovery 975 bluetooth headset which cost me twice as much. Though I haven't tried it in a noisy environment yet. I plan on getting a lot of use out of these as I use them for both work and play so I'll update my review if anything goes wrong or any issues develop.My only issue so far is that I wish it came with some sort of carrying case because they can get caught on things if you throw them in a bag. I don't want to put undue pressure on the wires. I think any heavy zip-lock or cloth bag would work for this though so I'm sure I won't have trouble finding something around this size to offer a little protection.On a side note, I don't know where these shipped from, but I ordered using Prime and they were on my doorstep 18 hours later as I was leaving for work, so I have to say I'm very happy with amazon shipping. One note on the packaging; I saw some reviewers say they had a difficult time opening the packaging, but I found it very easy. You just cut the 1 inch tape tab on the bottom of the box and it opens like a clam-shell. No other cutting, pulling or forcing required. Maybe they heard the complaints and updated the package.UPDATE: After a couple of weeks I'm still really enjoying these. I've found that they are a little strange to run with so I use regular workout headphones for that, but for work, they are wonderful. No more keeping a bluetooth headset in one ear and a headphone in the other when I'm expecting a call; I like being able to answer calls on the fly without removing the headphones. I saw that some people had an issue with an occasional skip in audio. I do get this occasionally, maybe once or twice a day, but it doesn't really bother me enough to worry about. I just wish I could get these working with my Windows 7 PC; why doesn't Microsoft include native A2DP support?

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-24: I am using this headset for about a month now.It is built well and provides a great sound both for calls and for playing music. It sits very comfortably on your neck and you actually forget that it is there.I was afraid that the ear piece will not fit well in my ears cannel but that concern turned to be not-relevant.     2012-07-19: I've tried so many Bluetooth Headsets in the last 2-3 years. These I just returned because I see the same thing happening. As with all of the others, they lose the connection thoughout the day. I'm sitting at a desk two feet from the laptop or tablet. And, I've had numerous laptops, tablets, phones etc. - same results - I don't get it. Windows or Mac or Android - or even Nokia - made no difference.I have to conclude Bluetooth is not ready for prime time. And, I will not buy another Bluetooth headset - nope not again. All I need is for the headset to maintain the connection so that I can make and receive skype calls throughout the day - that's it. I don't want to have to reconnect if someone calls or if I want to make a quick call. I don't get it - why can't this be accomplished.And, I really liked these. All the weight is in the part that rests - unnoticed - on your neck. And, when the ear buds fall out - as they inevitably do - they're right there a few inches from your ears so it's fast and easy to reinsert them.It's a brilliant design. And, when it was working - it worked very well. And, for music probably fine - good sound. Good range too.The magnet thing too is super clever. When the ear buds are not in your ears, they naturally get sucked into the ends via some magnets so they don't go flopping around. That's clever.Lastly, in terms of durability, I'm not sure these would have lasted all that long in my backpack anyway. They do seem a little fragile. I'm going to stick with my last set of BT - the Plantronics BackBeat 903+ They also lose connection all the time too but I didn't return those in time. And, they're more ruggedly built and smaller.But, I don't recommend those or any BT headset at this point. I just bought theBose MIE2i Mobile Headset'wired' headset and I'm thrilled with those - never fall out of my ears - and never disconnect - with excellent sound.

    Rating: 4

    2012-08-09: I bought this headset to replace the Plantronics Discovery 975. The Plantronics device provided very good sound quality, but I couldn't get it to fit comfortably in my ear, and it would often pop out during use. The LG headset is very comfortable, and listeners on the other end of my conversations have said that my voice sounds like I am using a land line. The ear buds fit nicely. I agree with other users who have recommended only using one bud and leaving the other ear open - It is better for safety as the buds block much of the external sounds, and being able to switch buds during long calls helps to avoid ear discomfort.The only reason that I am not giving the LG five stars is that I have only had it for about a month, so I can't yet rate reliable quality over the long haul. I certainly recommend it based on my experience to date.

    2011-11-04: These headphones are wonderful! They're extremely comfortable, both the buds and the neck-piece, the sound quality is superb (much better than other Bluetooth headphones I've used) and they're very easy to use. Pairing them and using them for music/podcasts on my Android phone was really easy, and the play/pause, call, volume buttons are really convenient and easy-to-locate. I was a little worried about looking silly wearing them, but with a jacket or collared shirt, it's hard to even see the neck part. I haven't tried using them for exercise yet, but I'm confident they'll work really well.

    2013-01-18: I received this headset two months ago, the sound fine, are easy to pair and look nice, BUT, the magnets that are set to hold the earbuds are really cheap, the buds may fall at anytime, they don't have the magnetic power to hold the earbuds in its space. The battery life is a joke! you are gonna need and extra battery to charge them (at least they use a mini USB that's standard for a good amount of devices and external batteries) or carry the charger and look for an outlet.If you are gonna keep them in your home/office close to a charger and in a place they won't suffer any kind of contact with rain, sweat and even wind, then go for them, they are great. If you plan to exercise or do outdoor activities, well, get a pair of good wired ones (such as Bose) .

    2012-05-23: After browsing thru several bluetooth headphones I chose this one because it won't get in the way while working out ( bench press and other stuff in the gym). But aside from that, I was very disappointed once I turned them on, the sound was very poor, the volume doesn't get high enough, and the ear pieces have this cables that tend to get loose on my bag, having to be very careful avoiding them to break while pulling them out.There is this light that blinks while you have it on, that even though it looks kind of cool, I would like to save the attention I receive due to the weird looking thing that hangs and shines in my neck. Battery is above average, I can use it for a week, 1 hour and a half each day and still have some left. It works with the voice recognition on my iPhone 4, so I guess it works with Siri on the 4S. Buttons are very well placed and work very nice. Overall, aside from the poor sound quality of the device I would recommend it.

    Rating: 3

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-15: I held out from buying Bluetooth headsets for a long time after my last pair (Motorola I believe) gave me too many issues during college from dropped signals. With LG scoring massive praise and high reviews, I finally thought I would jump in a deal offered by Newegg. I brought these headphones with me to the Philippines, after testing them for two weeks in Seattle with fairly decent results.At first the range was good with the headphones. I could leave my phone in one room and get up to fifteen feet away while receiving a good signal. Maybe eight feet with a wall between us. This was pretty good, the sound quality was great and noise isolation was acceptable.However, once I arrived in the Philippines I started having larger issues. My phone was unable to play to the headphones without skipping around a lot while I was exercising. Also, I found that the headset itself likes to jump around a lot, resulting in a bruised collar after about a mile of jogging nonstop. This was later partially solved by wearing a shirt with a smaller collar and placing the unit underneath, but I was still unable to listen to music without holding my phone in my hand within three feet of the unit.I became fed up with this after the third week that I've since thrown the headset into my luggage and refuse to acknowledge its pitiful existence. I've tried many things, from charging to testing from alternative sources and it has not given me the performance I was hoping for. And since I don't return back to the US until late April, I doubt I will be able to get a refund/claim on the item.

    2012-11-04: This is the most comfortable in ear headset I have ever used and I have a drawer full.I have used them for almost three months now, every day. If I don't use them to make calls then I listen to music or audiobooks.The range is pretty good. I can leave the phone in the charging dock by my bed and move around the adjacent rooms without a problem. This again is way better than some other headsets I have tried,They last over nine hours of constant use on audio, not sure if phone usage will impact this much.The audio quality is good to very good. They are not top of the line audiophile, but you would not want to use bluetooth for that anyway, right!I like that you use a standard micro USB charger. Less charging cables to take with you on travels.The pair very easily with either my iphone or ipad. Yes, I said either/or. They do not work with both at the same time. The manual clearly indicate that the multipoint functionality is only for one phone profile and one multimedia profile. This is the reason I took off one star. It was not in the online information...

    2012-01-13: I purchased this item for my husband, who works as a police officer, so while working a road detail, he can listen to his Sirius XM radio on his iPhone 4S and still be able to hear the police radio. He has about 4 hours of battery life if he is streaming the radio that whole time, which he states, he only had 4 hours of battery life on the phone normally, if he did the same with traditional headphones. The device seems a little odd at first, wearing it around your neck, but it is very light and comfortable.     Rating: 5

    2013-04-22: Bought this late 2012, and it worked great, as I mainly use it for listening to podcasts while walking, driving, anything, though I also answer a lot of calls with it. I can't do "behind the neck" style as I have a very thick neck, and this I can leave outside my shirt collar.Audio quality is quite good, and battery life is phenomenal. You practically forget it's there. Charge it in the morning, and even if you use it all day you'll only run out of juice just before you go to bed, and that's with HOURS of listening to podcasts, taking and making calls, etc.The magnet tips are very cool as they "take" the ear buds back so they don't wrap around your neck.Two problems, however, marred its existence.1) It only wants to pair to ONE host at a time. I have both a laptop with Bluetooth, and a smartphone. I really want the headset to pair to both so I don't have to swap things back and forth. Unfortunately, this cannot be done with this particular headset. It's either-or, not both.2) Months after purchase and almost daily use, the left earbud broke in half at the seam. Seems the glue just "popped". I glued it back together with superglue, but it seems I lost a wire connection as there's no more sound from the left bud, even though I detect no wire break.Oh, and you'll very likely lose one or both of the "retainer rings" that hooked the wire back to the main loop. I did. It's not critical, but it's likely that you'll end up yanking the wire too hard and thus rip the bud out of the body if you're not careful.For $60 or so, this is a very good stereo headset. It doesn't have the fancy shmancy voice control, status readback, or such, but its phenomenal battery life and comfort makes it worth considering. Just beware of its weaknesses

No longer will I use wired headsets, the freedom these provide is amazing. Battery is also superb for my use where I typically charge every other day. Battery has yet to go completely dead even after using with phone after several days. I probably use about 1-2 hours MAX of actual talk-time each day. The only small downside is with Bluetooth enabled on phone most of the day it does cause a noticeable battery drain on the phone:( However I'm now getting into habit of turning off Bluetooth on phone during long periods of stand-by and turning back on after answering call. Sync is a snap with phone, tablet and a GoGroove BT transmitter used for TV's and PC/Netflix while working out.

    2012-05-02: There are a lot of things to like about this design. I love how it sits around the neck. Sure, the bass function isn't much of a real bass, and the ear bud cables are just a tad too short. But for me, these concerns have been minor. For design, I'd give 4 stars. After 4 months, it's still holding up well, too, despite numerous drops on the ground and falling asleep many a night with it around my neck!I initially awarded 2 stars for performance, after having the unit for about 3 weeks. It seemed at the time that the range and strength of the Bluetooth radio was lessening significantly. However, this proved to be an issue with my iPhone--not the headset--and was easily solved with a reboot of the phone. So here I am correcting my initial review and going back to a full 4 stars!Update 2013/06/18: Still going strong. My chin sometimes toggles the forward/back rocker on the right side when I turn my head too far and scrunch my shoulders a bit (for whatever reason). It's a minor annoyance. I've pulled off my shirt on many occasions, forgetting that I had the headset on, and had it comes loose and clatter to the floor. No damage to speak of so far. A solid investment.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-12: I have owned about 4 hbs-700 headsets. The hbs-700 can't get much better although I do prefer the hbs-730The range is excellent. I can usually wander about two rooms away before losing my connection.The sound quality is excellent on phone calls or listening to music. People on the other end can't tell I'm on a wireless headset. I also like the magnetic ear bud holders although the bright orange is a little loud.The build quality is excellent, except for the ear buds where they come out of the neck piece. They need to reinforce the wires. My hbs-700 headsets have all failed at that specific location. Regardless, I get very good wear from these headsets. (typically I've gotten about 6 months out of a headset, 7 days a week 12 -18 hrs a day, running wires, crawling under desks, taking apart computers, replacing hard drives, etc.)I've probably owned 20 different sets of bluetooth headsets. These are hands down the best bluetooth headsets out there with the exception of hbs-730. At $60, these LG headsets easily blow away headsets that cost twice as much. They are MUCH better than plantronics, motorola, jabra etc.I've seen some headsets connect by a small wire, and have been tempted, then realized this is a better design. Here I can take the ear buds out of my ears, and I have a place for them that protects them, but keeps them handy.By the way, the headsets vibrate when a call is coming in, so you can tell your phone is ringing even if the ear buds are in their magnetic holders.If you are looking at the hbs-730, it differentiates itself from the hbs-700 with voice feedback that tells you you've answered a call, or that your bluetooth is connected, or disconnected. It also vibrates twice when it loses connection with your phone, or gets connected with your phone.The headsets come with 3 different sizes of ear buds, so even the smallest ears and biggest ears will be comfortable.They are a little bit nerdy, but they also command a lot of respect. I find that when I'm out and about on a very casual Saturday wearing raggedy shorts, a torn t-shirt, flip-flops, unshaven, and with my long hair down instead of in a pony tail, people still call me Sir and Mr. MyLastName. I was real surprised to find myself being treated so respectfully until I realized I had my hbs-730 headset on. I guess it just screams expensive high-tech, so the person wearing it must be a person of means who can afford to look his worst. ;-)Try them, you'll love them.PS. Yes, I am a computer consultant.

    2014-01-29: I tried the newer 730 model but the range is about 10-12 feet and will start to have drop outs and the sound quality is not better and tinny. We I do not understand is that if it is fullfilled by Amazon, why is the box opened and torn. Something smells fishy. I can guarantee that there are tons of fake units out there and even selling on Amazon. Well, i called Amazon and complained and they gave me a discount coupon and I bought another 700 that is sold and fullfilled by Amazon. This white one is only $44 and the black one is $79! So, after weeks or month of trouble I finally got myself, my wife the LG HBS 700. The form and function for this unit is the best in the market.     2013-12-17: When originally purchasing these headphones, I did some research. I wanted quality while also not spending some absurd amount. These headphones definitely do the job! If I'm going to be holding the phone for frequent mute toggle during conference calls, I could just use the speaker phone or a wired headset. Big disappointment!!! Small feature that is great for heavy business conf call usage. Other than that it is a great product.

    2012-12-28: I bought these for myself due to my brother's recommendation. Upon use, I found the headset comfortable and very efficient in sound delivery. Charge time took about an hour when completely dead, but usually I would plug it in for about 30 minutes after using it for 8 hours and I wouldn't have a problem with it.On a side note, the headset causes headaches and is interfered with library security systems. When I was going through our school's security system, I heard a slight buzzing. This is due to the interface between bluetooth and another wave frequency (nothing hurtful but something to be acknowledge). For the headaches, this should occur but is a reason why not to but blue too headsets. Bluetooth (when exposed to the nervous system) for extended periods of time, I found that I would have headaches and need to take a break for listening to my music. When I use my bose headset, I listen to music from anywhere of 8 to 14 hours a day. Having your nervous system exposed to a constant frequency is harmful to your body and you should be careful of this.

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-30: I had high hopes after reading several reviews. My biggest issue was that it bounces when jogging causing discomfort. It wraps around your neck and the heavy end is forward. It seamed to bounce on a bony part of my body. The sound was average and it does make a difference on how you seat the ear buds. All of the bluetooth features worked great with my Iphone4S. If you can live with average sound and are not using these to run then they should be fine. I returned these after 1 run.

    Rating: 2

    2012-09-07: This has been reviewed to death already, so I'll just toss in a few cents' worth:Music sound quality: very, very acceptable. If you're a screaming audiophile you're probably not listening to your phone, but this really, really sounds good. The Bass Boost is even a little too much, depending on what you're listening to.Phone quality: weirdly (to me) one of the best I've used.Controls: well thought-out, spaced and arranged.Convenience: Oh, wow. After a day with it, you'll see what I mean.Battery life: On a full charge, you will get tired before it does.Pairing: You don't really need to read the instructions.So --- what does this gadget need? In a word: COMPLY. Add the comply TX-400 ear tips. I have no idea what the bass gain is, or the noise db reduction is --- but, OH, WOW! Comfortable, great isolation --- just make sure you get the right size. (They have a "sampler" pack, small, medium, large. Find the right one, order the three-pair pack. The whole Comply thing will wind up costing you another $40, if you don't know your size already. Go for it.)

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-18: Great phone / stereo headset for travel, exercise, workign at computer, anything.As some note - easy to forget it's there. I also love the individual controls with great layout.Phone audio is a tiny tinny is about all I would change. Music sound is pretty good. Bass isn't booming but overall a great set for all I do.I really love the magnetic docking of the ear buds. Keeps them safe; easy to find (and they pop in when even close).I also love the micro-usb charging jack. Everybody who isn't should be migrating to this (like my funky charger / crappy Samsung 460 that was worth the $3 it cost after rebate)For my Android - HTC Incredible - I successfully bound in dual mode and it works great for both phone and stereo audio with one binding. I did have to use the manual bind method as the phone (likely and android OS issue) wouldn't see it in quick bind mode of the headset.Just a great package. Hoping they won some ergonomic awards for it.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-27: These headphones are easy to wear and operate above and beyond my expectations. The voice recognition works well. The range is pretty amazing I usually get clear signal up to about 30 feet and after that it will get a little choppy but still works up to about 40 ft. The text message reader has trouble with abbreviations and slang terms but other than that it is clear. Overall these headphones are packed with features and style for a very low price and well worth it.

    2013-01-16: I bought these for my son for christmas. I thought they looked cool so I bought them for myself. My daughter was having a bad week so I bought them for for and my youngest son got them for his birthday. That is four pair and all of us love them. Would recommend to everybody.

    2014-04-13: I got these headphones in June 2013 because my old one's USB port broke, and I got to say that I'm quite satisfied with them, except that you look a bit odd in them.This headset is pretty sturdy and quite flexible. It's also pretty lightweight, making it very comfortable to wear. The sound quality is excellent for this price and the type of headphones. What's also great is that when you plug them into your ears they also work as ear protectors, since they isolate your ear quite well. Another great feature is the call vibration alert, which makes the headset vibrate in case you get a call. But how is the call quality? Well, I got to say that it's decent. Granted, a phone connection will only provide a certain amount of quality, but that's unavoidable, so no points off there. Also there seems to be very little lag in between the phone (Nexus 5) and the headset, so that's a plus. In terms of battery life, I found that those headphones hold about 10 hours before beeping for power, and that's plenty of time. It also recharges pretty quickly over any micro USB cable, therefore making it fairly practical in case you need to quickly charge it up with your laptop.One thing I did notice though is that you may look a bit weird wearing them because it looks a bit like a collar. But hey, I'm willing to pay that price in order to enjoy wireless freedom.

    Rating: 5

    2011-09-02: All previous reviews are right on the mark, instantly connects with apples ipad 2, however with the ipod touch 4g you need to manually place the headset in pairing mode (with power switch off, press the call button and move the power switch to the ON side all at the same time for four seconds, this should manually pair the ipod touch 4g with your headset, bluetooth headset name shoud now appear in your ipod touch 4g. Remember to read the manual completely!

    2012-08-20: I bought this because the reviews were raving so much about what a great product it was. I'm generally a bit hesitant to buy LG equipment due to past experiences, but this headset has been amazing so far! I only hope that I can get many years of use out of it. I no longer get discomfort from over the ear headsets (Nokia BH-503) and I don't have the cords that generally come with ear buds. I haven't found a need for custom ear buds the ones included have worked very well for me.After about 4-6 hours, I occasionally get a little discomfort in my ear, but it is usually just because I pushed in the ear buds too hard. Taking them out for 20 minutes and putting them back in more careful generally fixes the issue.I was a little worried about sound quality, but I've been pleasantly surprised. The sound quality on these is much better than my Samsung wired ear buds. It is equal to my Nokia BH-503 over head BT headset but with the comfort of these, they are the clear winners. I also purchased these for family members and they have all loved them so far, even purchasing additional sets for their household.Great design and implementation by LG!

    Rating: 5

    2012-08-06: I have had a bunch of bluetooth stereo headsets from Jabra to BlueAnt and by far these are the best. Of the 5 different sets of bluetooth headsets I have owned over the years these don't drop the signal or cause static/stutter when the phone is in my pocket, camelbak, or across the room. Every other headset I had would get static or stutter if I had the phone in my left pocket and the headset in my right. They are actually pretty easy to clean, hold a charge for a long time, and are as clear as any bluetooth headset could be. I am not an audiophile and to be honest while I am working out, driving, working, or riding my bike I am not listening for audio quality like you would in setting more suited for that activity. These are light, comfortable, and best of all they work.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-31: I purchased the LG HBS-700 Bluetooth Stereo Headset in August 2011 from another retailer. I paid $48.70 with tax. My purpose was to listen to music while driving overnight when everyone else would be sleeping. I know it's against the law to use headphones/headset in both ears in most states but I am an avid mirror watcher so I took the risk. It made my driving duties bearable. And it transmitted Google map driving directions as well. The only drawback to using with Google maps is if you had a long period of time between last transmission/instructions such as long interstate driving it may miss the first part of the transmission. When driving around Chicago using secondary roads it worked very good.This headset sounds better than any cable/wired ear-buds I own. I have the Altec Lansing BackBeat Pro UHP606 with armature micro speakers which ran $99 new, Altec Lansing UHP106 with Ultimate Ears Technology, Skullcandy's Ink'd versions (1) and (2), the Apple earbuds included with the both the iPhone 4 and iPhone 5.Nothing compares to the sound and ease of using the LG HBS-700. The headset sits around your neck resting on your shoulders. You can put your phone in your pocket and control the audio or phone functions without removing it. The only time you would need to hold your phone is if you want to change your audio source such as going from Slacker to Pandora or when you need to make a call. You just can beat the freedom this headset gives you vs. being tethered to your phone by a cable. This makes working out, running or walking a breeze. The earbuds stay in great most of the time even after I start to perspire. The only problem I have had was when I perspired too much after about (3) miles and the play/pause button or fast forward/reverse controls did not work properly. After a few hours they worked again. So this headset is not perspiration proof but it did not suffer a permanent function problem. I wouldn't try wearing them in a rainstorm or they probably would suffer a meltdown.Pairing this headset to a Bluetooth source device is very easy. Takes only about (15) seconds the first time on an iPhone. It automatically pairs about 98% of the time when you turn on the Bluetooth enable source the next time. If it does not pair, I usually just turn off the power and then turn on again. 2% of the time I need to go into Bluetooth setting on the phone and manually pair it. This device has a range of about 30 feet and it works good when leaving a room going into another with walls in between. The headset can also pair over multiple sources/devices. I have a Logitech Bluetooth Boombox which must be manually paired if I am attempting to use it with another Bluetooth enabled device if it was not the last device it had been paired with.One of the BEST features of the LG's is the ability to activate loudness by holding BOTH the volume up and down at the same time WHILE YOU ARE LISTENING TO AUDIO. It will not activate until you hear some type of audio. When activated it beeps in your ear once. The sound just seems to jump at you after activating loudness feature.I still average about (10) hours listening to audio 1.5 years after purchase with the loudness always on before I need to recharge them. It takes between 2-3 hours to charge them fully using the included AC plug. The included AC charger is a 5.1 Volt Output at 0.7 amps. I have also used an AC Apple 5 Volt Output at 1.0 amp sugar cube charger with a USB to micro USB cable I purchased separately. And if on the go with no AC/DC charger, I have used a New Trent IMP50D Portable/External Battery with Output of both 5 Volts at 1 amp and 5 Volts at 0.5 amps using the same USB to micro USB cable. I use the 1.0 amp side to charge the iPhone while also using the 0.5 amp to charge the LG headset. But you cannot use the LG headset while it is charging. I have also used a Mediabridge Dual USB Car Charger putting out 1.0 amps. This car charger can put out 2.1 amps on one USB but I have not tried to use that one with headset. I use the 2.1 for my iPhone and it charges very quickly. I have experienced no problems with the headset using a source that puts out more than the included AC charger which puts out only 0.7 amps.The headset has controls on both the left and right sides. Those on the left side control volume up/down, a dedicated answer call/hang up call button and as stated above activate loudness function by holding up/down volume controls at same time. You can also use voice commands if your phone supports it by briefly pressing the dedicated answer call/hang up button. Last number redial, just hold the dedicated call answer/hang up button for one second and the headset makes the call for you. And before I forget, the headset vibrates when your phone rings if you are listening to audio. Great idea. The power on/off switch is on the outside of the left arm. The charging port is located on the inner side of the left arm behind swinging mini door. The right side has rewind/fast forwarding tracks and dedicated play/pause button.As far as phone call quality, I have never had a complaint while using this headset as a Bluetooth phone headset. The microphone is built into left side of headset. If you are only using only one earbud for calls use the LEFT side one. Otherwise if the left one is attached via the magnet to the headset it can hamper/block your voice from being heard clearly by the caller on the other end as the microphone sits just behind the left earbud where it attaches by the magnet. As a comparison, I have a top of the line Plantronics 975 Bluetooth headset which can only be used for phone calls. It ran $129 + tax when it first came out and I frequently receive complaints when using it for phone calls.CONS: The included AC Charger wire frayed just behind where the cable goes into the plug and you can see the colored interior cable. I used it only about 20-30 times and wrapped the cable around the charger for storage before it frayed. I taped mine up using electrical tape and it still works. Also where the earbuds sit when attached by the magnets is yellow/orange in color which stands out when you are using the earbuds. I see the new model HBS-730 is gray in color which is an improvement but I wonder why it is not black like the rest of the headset.Last CON is the only way you can see the present charge of the headset is to hold down the left volume control for (3) seconds. A HIGH charge is indicated by a solid blue for one second around the dedicated call answer/hang up button, violet for MEDIUM charge and red for LOW. You can't see percentages anywhere. If you see violet, charge your device immediately is my suggestion. I have gone from violet to red during a 1/2 hour walk and the unit starts beeping in your ear. It beeps more often the lower the charge and just plain turns off when it dies leaving you with no way to listen to audio at all short of your speakerphone on your phone.

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-19: For some reason i thought the sound on this device would be better. They look like they would sound better at least.For what it's worth, they work as advertised. They are wireless, they produce a2dp sound. That works. So when i'm on a treadmill, I can hear music (and control it) all wirelessly. They do shift around my neck, but it doesn't pop out an earbud. Just don't expect to be blown away by the sound.I guess that's why i knocked it a few pegs. There are tons of wireless Bluetooth headsets. Most have the same features. So i guess what you pay for here is the earbuds that hide in the system when not in use and the cool look.

    Rating: 3

    2012-02-24: These are great for a multitude of reason. Even though I gave them 5 stars, I find they have limitations that may or may not bug others.I try to wear these everywhere I go. I have tried multiple brands and models of bluetooth. I have very small ears, and struggle with earbuds that go in my ears. My most favorite bluetooth model ever, before these, the Motorola H730 sit OVER your ear and have a speaker pointing into your ear... don't protrude into your ear. I had to give them up because they don't stream audio from my iphone. Others, no matter their style, hurt my ears, even with the smallest silicone sized tips.These are just comfortable enough. I'd say for 95% of users, the size of these earbuds won't matter, and the sound quality, easy of uses, LARGE controls, a control FOR EVERYTING WITHOUT sharing 1 button to do multiple functions will keep you happy with your purchase. On top of that, the battery seems to last forever, they vibrate when a call comes in, and you can barely tell they are there when not in use. Stereo sounds great, using just 1 earbud works great. Lots of volume. No one has EVER complained or mentioned mic quality when on calls.I have been using them for 2.5 months and no one has ever commented on "what is that around your neck." I always wear collared shirts and tuck them under the collar, or inside my shirt.I have these few complaints- the magnets aren't strong enough and the earbuds are too large to lay on comfortable in bed (I know, who does this?). With just a casual bump, the earbuds fall out of their home. This has yet to irk me, but I think it might bother others. There are these cool, breakaway cable holders that make the earbuds easy to find if not in their home and yet let the cable go in case you catch them on something. Like I said, I have very small ears. To keep from bugging my wife, I use earbuds in bed before sleep. I can't use these because the earbuds themselves are quite large. I use Altec Lansing blitz earbuds for bedtime, and when and if these earbuds die, I'll soilder(sp) the smaller earbuds onto the wires. Like I said, it doesn't bug me when the earbuds don't lock in to their home, so this change won't bother me if I ever need to do it.Orange is ugly, but a sharpie will fix this.Work great on walks and in the car. I will only replace for use in the car when Motorola comes up with a newer, streaming model of H730s. You listening, Motorola?You won't regret buying these, especially if you like to have a seperate on off switch, a seperate answer call/end button, a seperate play/pause button, a seperate up and down rocker switch (switches actually), and individual next and last track controls.It did take a while to sort out its use with my car's stereo... which I use to stream my audio through a cable. Once connected to the car stereo, the ipod audio comes out the car stereo. When I take a call, I have to be carefull to answer using the button on the headphones. If I answer on the phone, I hear the person over the speakers, but there is no mic (my stereo doesn't have a mic). If I answer with the earbuds, I can talk and listen to the caller on the earbuds. Then, unforetunately, I have to manually select the car stereo on a menu on my iphone to resume listening there. Not a huge problem, I don't take a lot of calls in the car. I can also just toggle power to the LGs to regain car stereo audio.You can't charge these and use these at the same time... not rare on bluetooth headsets, but regretable I guess.These are great if you are in and out of your car alot. Just listen to music or audiobooks via the LGs, then you have little or no interuption as you get in and out of your car as the battery lasts forever.Lastly, if I had a very important meeting, the earbuds fit in my pants pocket.. I'd hate to do that regularly as it could break the cables. Would work great in a purse I suppose too.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-21: This is the best Bluetooth headset on the market today. Works with both my android devices and my iOS devices. It controls both my music and incoming and outgoing calls. When a call comes in the piece that goes around your neck vibrates in addition to the ringing inside the earphones to let you know you have a call. Although some people have issues because the earpieces with a lot of use where down and become broken. If you take care not to yank on the end pieces it will last a good long time. I wear these devices every single day and I've had mine's last over a year.

    2014-01-03: I use these every day. They sound great for inexpensive earbuds and fit well. The charge will last throughout the day without a problem.     Rating: 5

    2012-01-23: Stellar, lightweight design. But get this: the earbud cords that connect to the unit are just a little lightweight and rubbery. I can tell from the type of material used that these are designed to be sweatproof and should age well, but you'll need to treat them with a bit of respect to avoid tangles, kinks and outright breakage.Sound quality is good enough. I won't pretend to be an audiophile, but I have owned two sets of Sennheiser lanyard-style headphones for previous MP3 players that received excellent reviews for their fidelity, and I have to say that I can't tell a bit of difference versus some stock earbuds that I own -- not when I'm outside, walking the dogs at the park. These LGs are just fine.They're lightweight, and although I thought they'd be uncomfortable (or maybe just annoying) to wear around my neck, they really just "disappear." I just have to make sure to set the sliding cord retainers close to the "pods" on the neck piece, so as to avoid the buds from pulling out when I turn my head.Charging is quick via the included micro USB -- unfortunately via a port that's covered by a tethered plastic piece that I'm accustom to breaking off after a limited number of uses. Power is handled by a slider switch on one side; volume is handled by an appropriately sized rocker switch on the other. The pause/play button and FFWD/RWD rocker works with Google Music, but not Pandora.I love the concept of the magnetic earbud holders at the ends of this thing, but wish they were stronger. And the magnets don't solve the problem of the loose cord, which is left to snag on something if not stored and handled with respect.Nice sounding headset; a pleasure to be free from the cord!

It's like a part of my body now. Maybe I'm crazy, maybe it has mind control powers, I don't know. But I love this thing and I would recommend it to anyone in an instant.

    2013-11-14: I love my LG Tones!!! The sound quality is just as good as my Skullcandy Titaniums. I use them all day on a single charge. I don't know how I lived without them!

    Rating: 5

    2010-12-01: The LG HBS-700 is the third Bluetooth stereo headset that I have used (see my reviews of the Motorola S10-HD andJabra CLIPPER). As in my other reviews I will focus on the music experience as I use my Motorola T305 for hands free calling. After pairing this unit with my Droid X, I evaluated it for sound quality, ease of use, and comfort.Sound Quality: I don't have the strictest standards for music listening, but I haven't had many better listening experiences that I have with the 700. After changing out the earbuds for the larger set to get a good fit, I was ready to go. I can't emphasize enough the importance of getting a good seal between your ear and the earbud for sound quality. I have had this wrong on other earbuds in the past, and the difference in sound quality is night and day. For clarity of playback the only thing that I have gotten better sound from is my Creative Zen X-Fi with the EP-830 earbuds. While the 700 doesn't produce booming base, it is rare that earbuds do. By comparison I think that the 700 has better sound than either the Motorola or Jabra units that I have used.Ease of Use: This is an area where I think LG has really scored. The 700 has a dedicated on/off switch, and each of its controls does exactly one thing. There are dedicated buttons for play/pause, skip, and reverse for controlling your music player. In addition there are dedicated volume and call buttons too. Once you learn which side the controls are on, it is very easy to control the 700 without being able to see the controls.Comfort: If you have used earbuds with no issues in the past, you should have every reason to expect the 700 to be of similar comfort. I have listened for an hour and a half without giving any thought to the headset I was using. The unit itself rests like a necklace around your neck. The only potential issue I could see is that people with long hair may find that it gets tangled in the unit. If you are concerned about this, I would recommend checking out this unit in person. As of this writing you can do so at a Sprint store.The one caution I would issue would be around active use. I don't think the unit is designed to hold up to bouncing around, and it also does seem to be sweat resistant either. I would recommend the Jabra Clipper for active use. However I use the 700 while sitting at my desk at work. It does fine with normal walking around and light activity. I would just refrain from using it during exercise.Overall: The LG HBS-700 is a very strong offering. It hits the mark on sound quality, ease of use, and comfort. The only downside I see to it is that it was not designed for using during exercise. Otherwise I think that you will be happy with this unit.

    Rating: 5

    2012-03-20: This headset was very easy to pair and connect to my media player, as well as my phone.The sound on it is good. I am listening to music on them right now despite the fact that I have a surround sound system that cost close to $2,000. Ok it's mostly because I don't want to wake up my wife and daughter, but the sound is pretty good for a headset.I did make a couple phone calls and the persons voice came through well, and they could hear me like normal. They said it didnt sound any different than when we normally talk on the phone.Having this resting around my neck is comforatable so far. It is very light, i can easily forget it's there at all.There are some buttons on either side of the headset near where the earbuds would stick to for the volume and an on/off switch.One kind of annoying thing to me, just a little one is that while the cords to the earbuds in my ear are long enough to easily reach my ears; i find that if I turn my head to much it will cause the earbud to be pulled out.I would have enjoyed them being an inch or so longer, or having a retractable cord inside the plastic. It is more than ok though, and this is a very minor thing to me, but it is somewhat irritating and I wanted to let others know. it kind of makes me think of having my neck on a brace in the sense that I am unable to turn it to much without causing myself trouble.Overall I would recommend this to anyone else who needs or wants a blutooth headset for hands free calls while driving, or listening to music while you run or what not.I personally am happy with this product so far, and would buy it again.

    Rating: 4

    2012-06-24: I have to say that I just love these Bluetooth Stereo Headset.     2013-10-23: This headset is incredibly useful. I purchased it to be able to listen to various audio streams throughout the day at my desk, while mowing the lawn, while working on projects, and performing other tasks. My only complaint about it is that if I have multiple devices which have been connected to it, it proves very difficult to select which device is connected. It also will split connection between various devices, one for phone audio, another for media audio. I have other bluetooth devices which will accept both inputs from multiple sources simultaneously. That feature would be the best possible improvement for this unit.Other than that issue (which is a derivative of my usage of it) it meets or exceeds my expectations. Battery life is quite reasonable, I use it for several hours every day, and only have to charge it every other day. Once it's on my neck, I quickly forget that it's there. From a comfort perspective, it could due to be slightly longer from end to end, as my neck is significantly larger than the average, but it isn't a problem for me at the length that it is.

    2014-02-28: Well, I really wanted to love these headphones. They were, so I thought, everything I wanted them to be. They were comfortable, light weight, could be easily tucked away when not in use, they were great. There were a couple of issues though. If my phone was in my back pocket, somehow that interrupted the signal and it would fade in and out significantly.I lived with that issue though as the solution was, don't put it in my back pocket. I could accept that. A few months later though, the left ear phone started getting a little "staticky" for lack of a better term. Well about two weeks or so ago, I discovered a short in that ear bud. If I wiggle it around and hold it just right, I can get sound out of it, otherwise though, it is silent. I'm still tolerating it as I usually only use one side anyway (although it used to be the left for the most part). The right one now though is starting to do the same as the left did. I'm pretty sad about it.I really wanted them to work. The concept is fantastic, but the connections to the ear buds seems to be lacking in the sturdiness department. If you get them, tape that area down or something so that it stays put, that way you hopefully won't end up in the same boat as me.

    Rating: 3

    2012-04-30: Have been using this headset mainly to listen to music about 2 hours daily at the gym for a few weeks now with no problems. I replaced a Phillips over the ear waterproof headset, which failed after about 5 months. The LG has better sound quality, longer battery life, MUCH more comfortable fit, and due to the design has larger thus useable buttons. I pair with my Samsung Focus WP 7.5 and they sync fast and have good range. On occasion I get a phone call and the large buttons make answering a breeze, and the mike being around your neck makes for excellent voice quality, I do notice the callers voice volume is a bit lower than the music level but still ok for easy conversation. I charge them every 2 to 3 days, so not sure how long the charge last in terms of hours.The con's: They only come with one set of spare rubber cups and they are the same size. They are little large for my ear canals, but stay in place once I get them in there. They say they are waterproof (I guess they mean the speakers), but the cover over the charger port doesn't seem to be at all waterproof and is positioned so once you start sweating it lays right against my sweat soaked tee shirt collar, so far no problem but long term???They look like they would be cumbersome hanging around your neck but you really are unaware they are there unless you look in the mirror then they look a little geeky.For the price I don't see how you could beat them.

    2013-01-08: Wow, what a roller coaster this has been! I am rating the LG HBS-700 ($45.99 w/free prime shipping). We had the MOST difficult time getting the bluetooth to work with our phone. Upon initial connection, the bluetooth paired seamlessly. Our issue was it would not stay connected. It would disconnect every 15 - 30 seconds and simply say "bluetooth disconnected" but would reconnect right away, only to be disconnected again. This was so very frustating! I did some internet research outside the Amazon forum and found that there is a known problem with the HTC and LG interface. There's supposed to be a software push to fix the bug but that obviously hasn't happened yet.Here's how we resolved the issue:1. Wi-Fi has to be turned off on your phone2. Restart Phone3. Voila! Bluetooth Disconnect issue is resolved!I hope this review saves someone the frustration we went through. We returned 3 headsets before the light bulb came on to do some online troubleshooting. I purchased this for my husband because he loses standard bluetooth's too easily. This was the perfect solution for him because it is covert and I don't have to worry about him losing it. He loves it and says it's very comfortable. I think this is the best bluetooth on the market currently if you can avoid the connection issues or work around them.

    Rating: 4

    2011-11-05: Amazon is going to be angry with me because I usually buy EVERYTHING from them. This time, I needed this faster than I would be able to get it via mail - so I bought it from a retailer and paid $10.00 more for it than if I had bought it from Amazon (sorry for going to another retailer on this one Amazon).I am using this product (mainly) on an iPhone 3GS.I am in LOVE with this product.My boss allows me to use my iPhone to listen to podcasts and watch movies (in the background) while I work (as long as I do my job and stay productive!). Recently, a co-worker moved near my work area and didn't like some of the things that I listen to. So I went to earbuds. Worked out great, but the wires were in my way. So I needed a wireless audio solution.Being a very technical person - my first thought was that if you TRANSMIT something - there will be a DELAY. So I was concerned that audio/video would not sync up properly.After much research - I chose this product.Turned out to be a GREAT choice! The audio/video has ZERO delay issues. Now I HAVE seen a delay problem a FEW times. I've only had this problem AFTER pairing the device with ANOTHER source. Something gets out of sync. - but if you go to settings (on the iPhone) and disable the device and then re-enable it - the delay disappears.Now then - a few pro's and con's:Pro's:1. EASY PAIRING. My iPhone paired with it quickly and easily.2. Charges FAST - I think I had it on the charger for around 10 minutes. The light went out (indicating full charge) and I thought 'wow! Really? Already?'.3. Long battery life. I haven't had them long enough to say for sure - but they advertise 10 hours of play time. I've been on them at LEAST 6 hours now and they are doing fine.4. Very comfortable.Con's:1. The audio quality is better than expected for a bluetooth device - BUT - They do NOT match my sony earbuds. They don't have quite the bass "thump" or clarity. That said - the sound quality IS impressive for a wireless device and it is beyond acceptable - I'd even repeat that impressive is the right word for the audio.2. There is no 2. And con number 1 is very minor unless you are a die-hard audiofile. The sound quality is beyond what I expected for a wireless device.Hope this review helps. And to anyone who doesn't need it as fast as I did - you SHOULD buy from Amazon. They have the best price.- Ron*** Added Information ***Ok - it hasn't ever charged QUITE as fast as the first time. I'm thinking that the thing had a charge when I bought it. Still, it charges at a reasonable rate. I used it ALL DAY today and it re-charged in around an hour. Not bad.
